Class AppStateMgr

java.lang.Object
AppStateMgr
public class AppStateMgr extends Object
Singleton manager for saving and loading the application state to and from a file. This class provides methods to serialize the current AppState to disk and restore it later. The state is stored in a file defined by STATE_FILE. The class uses a singleton pattern to ensure only one instance exists.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static AppStateMgr

    Returns the singleton instance of AppStateMgr.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static AppStateMgr getInstance()
      Returns the singleton instance of AppStateMgr. Creates a new instance if none exists.
      Returns:
      the singleton AppStateMgr instance

    • writeFileState

      public void writeFileState()
      Serializes the current application state to disk. This method updates the AppState with the current in-memory lists from the DbMgr singletons before writing to the file. If the state or any object is not serializable, an error is printed.

    • readFileState

      public void readFileState()
      Reads the application state from disk and restores it into memory. If the file does not exist, a message is printed and no changes are made. After successful deserialization, the stored lists in AppState are restored back into the singleton DbMgr instances.
